result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney L. Booker Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to Ct 2, but Consecutive to Prison sentence in Cts 4 & 5.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.   Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided)
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No driving unless properly licensed and insured.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to prison sentence in Cts 4 & 5.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Sentencing arguments made.
Count 1 -   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions concurrent to Count 2 but consecutive to prison sentence in Counts 4 & 5.  Conditions are the same as extended supervision in Cts 4 & 5
Count 2 -   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions concurrent to Count 1 but consecutive to prison sentence in Counts 4 & 5.  Conditions are the same as extended supervision in Cts 4 & 5
Counts 4 & 5 - DE is sentenced to 4 years in the WSP forthwith; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 3 years Extended Supervision.  Counts 4 & 5 are concurrent to each other, but consecutive to any other sentence.
DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Cash Bond on deposit in 15CF180, 14CF1353 and 15CF31 shall be applied to any costs.  
Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
